description:
The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You thrive on making processes more efficient and scalable, you work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our outsourcing partners and internally, you collaborate across the five areas of the Financial Operations team: Global Revenue Operations, Procure to Pay, Electronic Payment Services, Business Process Outsourcing, and Payroll.

The Process Governance and Advisory is a shared service team part of Customer and Partner Operations (CPO) and manages Risk, Controls and Documentation across several process under Finance.

As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to govern and control the overall CPO processes and systems. You will collaborate with various stakeholders (e.g., sales, product management, engineering and vendors) to deliver services for CPO and Finance overall.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or Operations or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of relevant work experience in audit, payments, compliance, or banking.
  • Experience in designing, implementing and testing processes and controls for both standard systems and custom applications.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment and to lead and drive complex operational initiatives.
  • Ability to navigate through ambiguity in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Collaborative working style and ability to work with vendors and international teams.
  • Developed analytical and investigative skills.
  • Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Drive compliance for Revenue to Cash operations, and ensure risk assessment and control frameworks are in place and running effectively and efficiently.
  • Manage projects and implement initiatives to improve risk and controls around operational processes and systems for Revenue to Cash.
  • Project manage testing programs and monitor execution of controls.
  • Partner with process managers and engineering to review system designs and implement critical system controls for operations.
  • Drive efficiency while working with vendors, TVCs and Outsourcing companies.
title: Project and Process Manager, Customer and Partner Operations
